coredata.dc:title: Multi-particle effects in second harmonic generation
coredata.dc:creator: Samson, R.
Pasmanter, R.A.
coredata.dc:description:
Abstract
It is shown that at certain fluid densities the intensity of two polarizations of the second harmonic light scattered by simple fluids is essentially due to a three-body effect. In principle this opens the possibility of direct spectral observation of triplet correlation functions. The order of magnitude of the scattered intensity is estimated and it is concluded that with the present experimental techniques, the effect probably is not observable. These computations are based on a microscopic expression for the second harmonic intensity, which retains multipolar interactions between the particles to all orders.
